info.title: iotery.io REST API
info.description:
This documentation describes all available API routes for interacting with the iotery.io Platform.  These routes are intended to be used in implementing your applications and in processing the webhooks that are defined in the API.

 # Authorization

Some description

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

post.summary: Get token for device via key, serial, and secret.

200.description: The response returns a token, expiration time, and device information.

patch.summary: Set a collection of batched command instances as executed.

timestamp.description: Provide a unix timestamp for when the commands were executed.

200.description: The response returns a success status.
The response provides the broker URI and port number.

post.summary: Report an already executed set of commands to the server.

200.description: The response provides a success status.

patch.summary: Report that a command has been executed to the server.

timestamp.description: Provide a unix timestamp for when the command was executed.

200.description: The response provides success status, active notification instances, and a list of unexecuted commands.

get.summary: Get a list of available command types.

200.description: The response provides a list of command types.

get.summary: Get the current server time in epoch (unix) time.

200.description: The response comes in the form of a epoch (unix) timestamp.

get.summary: Get a list of available data types.

200.description: The response provides a list of data types.

schema.description: The request body is an empty object.

200.description: The response provides the updated device object.

post.summary: Create a command instance via a device.

schema.description: The request body is an empty object.

200.description: The response provides the created command instance.
The response provides success status.
The response provides success status and a list of current settings.

get.summary: Get a list of settings for a device.

200.description: The response provides a list of settings.

get.summary: Get a list of unexecuted command instances for a device.

200.description: The response provides a list of unexecuted commands.

post.summary: Upload zip file of device logs.

schema.description: The file is uploaded as form data.

200.description: The response provides success status.

get.summary: Get a desired version of a firmware record for a given device type.

200.description: The response provides a firmware record.

get.summary: Get base64 encoded public key from the server for use in RSA scheme.

200.description: The response provides a base64 encoded public key.
The response provides device information.

get.summary: Get a list of available notifications.

200.description: The response provides a list of notifications.

timestamp.description: Provide a unix timestamp for when the notification was set as inactive.

200.description: The response provides success status.

get.summary: Get a list of available setting types.

200.description: The response provides a list of setting types.

post.summary: Get device token based on encrypted credentials.

credentials.description: The credentials must be base64 encoded and encrypted using an RSA scheme.

200.description: The response is a base64 encoded RSA encrypted device uuid/key, token, and expiration time.
